results.title: GI blues
results.creator_credit: Norman Taurog, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Elvis plays a singing GI, stationed in West Germany who has plans for life after the Army; opening a nightclub back home. The only problem is that he’s a bit short of cash and must take part in a wager to raise sufficient funds. The bet: he must melt the iceberg heart of a willowy cabaret dancer (Juliet Prowse). Complications arise when he begins to fall for her, and trouble can only ensue when she discovers the bet. Features the following songs: “GI Blues”, “Tonight is so right for love”, “Wooden heart” and “Blue suede shoes”. Cast includes Elvis Presley, Juliet Prowse, Robert Ives and Leticia Roman.

results.title: Blazing saddles
results.creator_credit: Mel Brooks, Michael Hertzberg and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The land at Rock Ridge is worth a fortune, but strictly off limits to outside investors as the townsfolk already own their land. The only option is to drive them out by sending in the roughest, leanest, toughest gang you can muster and appoint a sheriff (Little) who is ill equipped to deal with their arrival. The black sheriff realises that the situation is out of his control and calls on a professional, one of the jail’s cons, who was also one of the fastest guns in the West. This is the overarching plot that serves as a vehicle for Mel Brook’s lunatic brand of humour aimed at a cineliterate audience. Includes Madeline Kahn’s Academy Award nomination performance in her Marlene Dietrich sendup. Cast includes Cleavon Little, Gene Wilder, Slim Pickens and David Huddleston. Screenplay by Mel Brooks, Norman Steinberg, Andrew Bergman, Richard Pryor and Alan Uger.

results.title: Hard target
results.creator_credit: John Woo, Sean Daniel, James Jacks, Renaissance Productions and Alphaville
results.brief_description: Chance Boudreaux (Jean Claude Van Damme) is a down on his luck Cajun soldier, reluctantly hired by Nat Binder (Yancy Butler) to help find her father, an ex Green Beret who is currently homeless in Louisiana. What they both don’t know is that their mission is doomed to fail, as Nat’s father has been brutally murdered as sport. His killer is the ruthless Fouchon (Lance Henriksen), a mercenary who procures homeless people living around New Orleans and enlists them in his game, whereby they become the live targets. This film features enough of John Woo’s trademark action and Jean Claude Van Damme’s physical presence to satisy Woo and JCVD fans.

results.title: Only you
results.creator_credit: Norman Jewison, Charles Mulvehill, Robert N. Fried, Gary Woods, Tri-Star Pictures, Yorktown Productions Ltd and Fried Woods Films
results.brief_description: This very romantic comedy is all about a girl named Faith (Marisa Tomei) who searches for her “soul mate” named Damon Bradley. She was advised of this name by the Ouija board and a gypsy fortune teller. A week before her wedding, “Damon” phones to say he is unable to attend. Faith believes she must leave her fiancee, travel to Italy, and find her date with destiny”. During her search, the wrong man (Robert Downy Jnr) falls madly in love with her. What is she to do? With breathless scenery and brilliant performances, it’s irresistible entertainment that everyone will enjoy. Cast also includes Billy Zane and Fisher Stevens.

results.title: Halloween
results.creator_credit: John Carpenter, Debra Hill and Falcon Film
results.brief_description: John Carpenter’s much imitated ‘Halloween’ defined the eighties stalk and slash genre, spawning inferior copies like the ‘Friday the 13th’ series (including six sequels of it’s own), and for a time making star Jamie Lee Curtis into the premium “scream queen”. Later on the conventions of the genre were cleverly re-invented for a nineties audience by director Wes Craven and writer Kevin Williamson in ‘Scream’, which pays direct homage to ‘Halloween’. John Carpenter opens his film with an unnerving point of view shot of the young psychotic Michael Myers brutally stabbing his teenage sister to death on Halloween night. Flash forward to Halloween 15 years later and Michael has escaped the mental institution he has been locked up in. Meanwhile shy, virginal teenager Laurie Strode (Jamie Lee Curtis) and her girlfriends are preparing for Halloween, unaware of the menace that lurks in their quiet suburban community. Carpenter makes great use of the sparse, atmospheric music score (which he also composed), and uses to maximum creepy effect the white mask Michael Myers wears throughout the film. The film also established the classic horror genre rule- if your a sexually active teenager, you die! Cast also includes Donald Pleasence, P.J. Soles, Tony Moran.

results.title: Silk stockings
results.creator_credit: Rouben Mamoulian, Arthur Freed, Arthur Freed Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: In this exuberant song and dance remake of Lubitsch’s ‘Ninotchka’, Fred Astaire and Cyd Charisse team up as the leading couple. Ninotchka, a stern lady Communist (Charisse) comes to Paris to retrieve three wayward comrades (Peter Lorre, Jules Munshin, Joseph Buloff) and a Russian composer (George Tobias). Much to her surprise, she is seduced by the trappings of capitalism in the form of champagne, silk stockings and a suave American producer (Fred Astaire), all of which contradict her Communist sensibilities. Includes songs such as: “Fated to be mated”, “All of you”, “The Ritz Rock and Roll”, “Silk stockings”, “Red blues”, “Josephine” and “Stereophonic sound”. Music and lyrics by Cole Porter. Screenplay by Leonard Gershe and Leonard Spigelgass.

results.title: Planes, trains and automobiles
results.brief_description: It’s Thanksgiving and Neal Page (Steve Martin) is looking forward to spending some quality time with the family. While on the flight home, Neal is seated next to obnoxious shower curtain ring salesman Del Griffith (John Candy). When a snow storm causes their plane to be rerouted, the two are reluctantly united by their misfortune. Thus begins a disastrous chain of events that transcends all forms of public transport and threatens to make Neal miss Thanksgiving all together.

results.title: Kids (D)
results.creator_credit: Larry Clark, Cary Woods, Gus Van Sant, Patrick Panzarella, Michael Chambers, Leigh Blake, Excalibur Films, Independent Pictures and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: ‘Kids’ is a shocking movie representing an underground youth culture of excess and liberty to the extreme in an inner-city urban habitat. The viewer is taken on a 24-hour urban jaunt, alluding to amoral grit and an excessive depiction of nihilistic youth as a sensationalized pseudo-documentary. The film focuses on freckled boy Telly (Leo Fitzpatrick), whose idea of safe sex is to only have sex with virgins. His theory is disproven when a girl from one of his past unprotected passions tests positive to HIV. Cast includes Leo Fitzpatrick (Telly), Sarah Henderson (Girl #1), Justin Pierce (Casper) and Joseph Chan (Deli Owner). Written by Larry Clark, Leo Fitzpatrick and Jim Lewis. Peter Bici, Jeff Pang, Harold Hunter, and many others from the movie are professional skateboarders on the Zoo York team.

results.title: Rio Bravo
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Armada Productions and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Sheriff John T. Chance arrests a gunslinger for a brutal murder. However, the outlaw’s brother is the most powerful rancher on the border and his desperadoes surround Rio Bravo so that Chance can’t get his prisoner out and the U.S. Marshall can’t get in. Hired gunmen slip silently into the little town, waiting for a chance to strike. This classic western combines the talents of John Wayne and Dean Martin with the much acclaimed skill of Howard Hawks.

results.title: Sabrina = Sabrina fair
results.brief_description: Linus and David Larrabee are the two sons of a very wealthy Long Island family. Linus is all work, while David is all playboy. Meanwhile, Sabrina Fairchild is the young, shy, awkward daughter of the family’s chaffeur, who has been infatuated with David all her life. After a two year absence in Paris, Sabrina returns an elegant, sophisticated and beautiful woman. Suddenly, she finds that she has finally captured David’s attention, but as she does so, she finds herself falling in love with Linus, and he with her. Cast includes: Humphrey Bogart, Audrey Hepburn, William Holden and Walter Hampden.
